section.name: Serving binaries with the BinariesServlet
section.p: The HST contains a servlet for serving binaries, e.g. a gif image or a pdf document. The servlet should be installed in your web.xml, see configuration.

subsection.name: How does it work?
subsection.p: All data in Hippo Repository is stored as property of a certain node. The BinariesServlet will look for a node in the repository based on the URL it gets. If the application uses the URL mappingfunctionality, it will transform the incoming URL to a path in the repository, if not it will just use the incoming URL directly as repository path. Then, the repository node found by the servlet should have the following two properties: jcr:mimeType and jcr:data.
If above node and properties are found, the servlet will

ul.li: Set the found mime type to the response
Write the property as stream to the response

subsection.name: Usage
subsection.p: It is common use to access the BinariesServlet in the src attribute of a img tag, or in the href attribute of the a tag.
